unnormalised: Sources say the new TCS office in Kolkata is causing a bit of a traffic jam near the Technopark area! Apparently, it's located at Plot No. 23, Sector V, Salt Lake City, Kolkata, 700091. Ever since they opened shop on 10/10/2024, the usual rush hour traffic has gotten even more, well, rush-ier!
normalised: Sources say the new T-C-S office in Kolkata is causing a bit of a traffic jam near the Technopark area! Apparently, it's located at Plot Number twenty three, Sector V, Salt Lake City, Kolkata, seven hundred thousand ninety one. Ever since they opened shop on tenth October two thousand and twenty four, the usual rush hour traffic has gotten even more, well, rush-ier!

unnormalised: Locals are saying that the problem is compounded by the fact that many employees are still figuring out the best routes. Some are coming from as far as Barrackpore and even Diamond Harbour! Add to that the auto-rickshaws and buses trying to squeeze through, and you've got yourself a proper Kolkata traffic scenario, na?
normalised: Locals are saying that the problem is compounded by the fact that many employees are still figuring out the best routes. Some are coming from as far as Barrackpore and even Diamond Harbour! Add to that the auto-rickshaws and buses trying to squeeze through, and you've got yourself a proper Kolkata traffic scenario, na?

unnormalised: Word on the street is that the local council is considering some changes to traffic flow around the PS Srijan Corporate Park, near their address at SDF Building, Sector V. Let’s hope they find a solution soon! Maybe they'll add another flyover, or perhaps prepone office timings to decongest the main rush hr i.e 9 AM to 11 AM? Only time will tell!
normalised: Word on the street is that the local council is considering some changes to traffic flow around the P-S Srijan Corporate Park, near their address at S-D-F Building, Sector V. Let’s hope they find a solution soon! Maybe they'll add another flyover, or perhaps prepone office timings to decongest the main rush hour, that is, nine A-M to eleven A-M? Only time will tell!
